content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Perfect mix of simplicity and slight tweak in the rounding to force players to read all instructions

* Should be "round to 2 decimal places", you're currently asking for 100 decimal places :)

Good Clash, with just enough annoying-precision tests to catch out the players who submit their first attempt without waiting for every test to run.
Upvoted

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's a good, clear contribution.

The goal is simple, but carrying it out is still quite challenging.

Well Done, Steve!

Happy Coding!

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It's easy to fix, but not too easy. So it's appropriate for a no-brainer clash

Hello, in your solution after "else", you can use formated text:

print(f"{c:.2f")

It's nice, because of constraint on output type.

General
* The descriptions of [[b]] and [[h]] aren't accurate - in some cases, their values are negative, but heights and widths cannot be negative.

* A parabola doesn't have a width or a height.

* The notation of "area of a parabola" is unclear, as a parabola isn't a closed shape. Please write a precise description.

* Please refer to https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parabola#Area_enclosed_between_a_parabola_and_a_chord when you rewrite the statement.

Goal
* Please format the unformatted h and b as [[variables]].

* Please change "equation" to "formula" for consistency.

* Please delete the last sentence; it merely repeats what is shown in Example section.

Input
* Please add line numbers in <<bold>> (<<Line 1>> and <<Line 2>>).

* Please specify the variable types, e.g. "A float [[b]]".

Output
* Please delete ", modeled by the variable Area".

* Unclear requirement on what to do when the area is not a whole number. Also note that the default number of decimal places is different for different programming languages, so you *must* specify an exact rounding requirement.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar but must be different (except for edge cases). Please revise the cases accordingly.

Stub generator
* The variables are "float", not "string".

Thanks.
Thanks for your help! I'll make swift modifications sometime this weekend. :D
Thanks for your help! I'll make sure to reference this in future projects :D

Thank you for making the changes. Below is my comments based on the revised version:

Input
* Please change "<<1.>>" to "<<Line 1>>:".

* Please change "<<2.>>" to "<<Line 2>>:".

Constraints
* Please write the inequalities in separate lines.

* Please move the output requirement to Output section.

Thanks again.
